1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: 僕 明日から パンダじゃなくなるんだ
1.english: I'm not gonna be a panda anymore after tomorrow.

3.speaker: PENGUIN
3.english: What are you saying all of a sudden?

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: だから パンダじゃなくなるの
5.english: I'm saying, that I won't be a panda anymore. Oh?

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.english: Is this something we can just ignore?

7.speaker: SASAKO
7.japanese: じゃあ 何になるの？
7.english: Then what are you going to be?

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: いや… パンダは パンダ以外にはなれないでしょ
9.english: I don't think pandas can be anything other than pandas.

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: 配置換えを希望したもん
11.english: I requested a change in position.

14.speaker: KIRINO
14.japanese: 非常勤パンダ アナグマコーナーに配属を命ず
14.english: Part-time Panda is hereby reassigned to the Badger Corner. -Zoo Director."

15.speaker: HANDA
15.japanese: パンダくんが アナグマコーナーに？
15.english: Panda's going to the Badger Corner?

16.speaker: KIRINO
16.japanese: 何 考えてるんですかね？ 園長は…
16.english: I wonder what in the world the director is thinking.

17.speaker: PANDA
17.japanese: 今日から配属になった パンダです
17.english: Hello, I've just been reassigned here. My name is Panda.

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: よろしくお願いしま～す
18.english: It's a pleasure to work with you.

19.speaker: BADGER1
19.japanese: えっ！？ パンダくん アナグマになったの？

20.speaker: PANDA
20.english: There was a decree put forth.

22.japanese: まぁ パンダの目も 夜行性動物と同じらしいからね
22.english: Well, pandas do share some traitswith nocturnal animals.

23.speaker: PANDA
23.english: Let's not talk about difficult things.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: 僕 アナグマ がんばるよ
24.english: I'll do my best as a badger!

25.speaker: BADGER1
25.japanese: じゃあ 一緒に穴を掘ろうか
25.english: Then let's dig a hole together.

28.speaker: HANDA
28.japanese: ちょっと パンダくん 起きてよ！

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: あぁ 半田さん おはよう

30.speaker: BADGER1
30.japanese: ちょっと 半田さん！

31.speaker: BADGER1
31.japanese: パンダくん 寝てばかりで
31.english: All Panda's been doing is sleeping,

32.speaker: BADGER1
32.japanese: アナグマとしてのやる気が 全然 感じられないよ
32.english: so I don't feel that he's serious about being a badger.

33.speaker: PANDA
33.japanese: やっぱり やる気がないからかな？
33.english: I wonder if it's because I don't have any intention to be one.

34.speaker: HANDA
34.japanese: 自分で 配置換え 希望したんでしょ？
34.english: But you requested the reassignment, didn't you? But it's so dark in here.

35.speaker: PANDA
35.japanese: 日の当たらないパンダは
35.english: A panda that's not out in the sun

38.speaker: PANDA
38.japanese: 別の所に配置換えを頼んでみるよ
38.english: I'll ask to be reassigned to somewhere else.

39.speaker: HANDA
39.japanese: そんな希望 通るわけないでしょ
39.english: There's no way they're going to approve that.

41.speaker: KIRINO
41.english: An otter now? Hello, I've been reassigned here. My name is Panda.

42.speaker: PANDA
42.japanese: よろしくお願いしま～す
42.english: Pleasure to work with you. You better do your best. It's not easy being an otter.

43.speaker: OTTER
43.japanese: じゃ 早速 飛び込んでみようか
43.english: All right, I guess you'd better hop in.

44.speaker: PANDA
44.japanese: 僕は ここで見てるよ
44.english: I'll just stand here and watch.

46.speaker: OTTER
46.japanese: ラッコは 水の中に入らないとダメでしょ
46.english: Otters have to be in the water.

47.speaker: OTTER
47.japanese: じゃあ これ 割ってみようか
47.english: Why don't you try breaking this open?

48.speaker: OTTER
48.english: This is important. If you can't open a clam, you can't be an otter.

51.speaker: OTTER
51.japanese: じゃあ やってみようか

53.speaker: OTTER
53.english: You have to put more strength into it.

55.speaker: OTTER
55.japanese: 何言ってるの がんばってよ
55.english: What are you talking about? Try harder.

56.speaker: PANDA
56.japanese: お腹 痛いんだよね

57.speaker: OTTER
57.english: So does mine. Oh, I know!

58.speaker: PANDA
58.japanese: ラッコさんのお腹で割らせてよ
58.english: Let me break it on your stomach.

59.speaker: OTTER
59.japanese: 人のお腹で 貝割るラッコなんていないよ？
59.english: No self-respecting otter would ask another to break a clam on their stomach.

62.speaker: OTTER
62.japanese: この新人さん ダメだよ

63.speaker: PANDA
63.japanese: そもそも 貝割らないからね パンダは
63.english: Well, pandas don't break open clams in the first place.

64.speaker: PANDA
64.japanese: 仕事としては割るけど
64.english: I'd do it if it was my job, though.

66.speaker: PANDA
66.japanese: 半田さん ラッコはムリだよ
66.english: I won't be able to be an otter, Mr. Handa.

67.speaker: HANDA
67.japanese: パンダくんが配置換え 希望したんでしょ？
67.english: But you requested the reassignment, didn't you?

69.speaker: KID
69.japanese: お母さん 早く早く

72.speaker: PANDA
72.japanese: 桐野くん… もう一人いないと 僕 ラマできないからね
72.english: Well, I can't be a llama without someone to help me.

73.speaker: KIRINO
73.japanese: でも 僕 他に仕事が…
73.english: But I have my other duties to attend to.

74.speaker: PANDA
74.japanese: ラマをするのも立派な仕事だよ？
74.english: Being a llama is an important job, too.

76.speaker: KIRINO
76.japanese: でも 前が見えなくて 苦しいね
76.english: But I can't see anything and it's hard to breathe.

77.speaker: PANDA
77.japanese: じゃあ 前後交代する？
77.english: Do you want to trade places, then?

78.speaker: KIRINO
78.japanese: 僕が前だと 意味ないんじゃ…
78.english: I don't think there's a point to me being up front. I guess the frontis better for me.

79.speaker: LLAMA
79.japanese: こんにちは パンダくん

81.speaker: PANDA
81.japanese: よろしくお願いしま～す

83.speaker: PANDA
83.japanese: ねぇねぇ 僕 何か ラマっぽいことしたほうがいいよね
83.english: Hey, I should probably do something llama-like, huh?

84.speaker: LLAMA
84.japanese: 別にいいんじゃないでしょうか

86.speaker: LLAMA
86.japanese: 誰も見ないと思うんですよ
86.english: Well, I don't think anyone will be looking. Everyone goes right over to the Giraffe Corner next door. It's a giraffe!

90.speaker: HANDA
90.japanese: どう ラマうまくやれてる？
90.english: How's it going? Are you pulling off being a llama?

92.speaker: PANDA
92.japanese: あのね ここはちょっと やりがいがないと思うんだよね
92.english: I don't think there's much of a point in me being here.

94.speaker: KIRINO
94.japanese: え～っ！ 今度は飼育係？
94.english: What?! Now he's a zoo keeper?

95.speaker: KIRINO
95.japanese: 先輩 パンダが飼育係ってありですか？
95.english: Is it even possible for a panda to be a zoo keeper?

96.speaker: PANDA
96.japanese: 半田さん 桐野くん 今日も１日頑張ろう！
96.english: Mr. Handa, Kirino, let's all do our best and work hard today!

97.speaker: HANDA
97.japanese: パンダくん ちゃんとやってるかな
97.english: I wonder if Panda is actually working...

100.speaker: PANDA
100.japanese: はい ふれあい動物園です
100.english: Hello. This is the petting zoo.

101.speaker: PANDA
101.japanese: 僕 よくわからないので あとでかけ直してください
101.english: I don't really understand, so please call back later.

102.speaker: PANDA
102.english: Bye. Wow, this hot spring looks great. I wonder where it is?

103.speaker: HANDA
103.japanese: パンダくん 何してるの
103.english: What are you doing, Panda? Oh, good timing.

104.speaker: PANDA
104.japanese: ねぇねぇ この 温泉どこにあるか知ってる？
104.english: Hey, do you know where this place is?

105.speaker: HANDA
105.japanese: そこ僕の席なんだけど

106.speaker: PANDA
106.japanese: あぁ 半田さん 安心して

107.speaker: PANDA
107.japanese: 半田さんの荷物は そこに置いておいてあげたよ
107.english: I put all your stuff in a box right over there.

108.speaker: HANDA
108.japanese: ちょっと 勝手に片づけないでよ
108.english: Hey! Don't move my stuff around without permission!

109.speaker: HANDA
109.japanese: っていうか みんなに飼育係の 仕事させて何やってるの！
109.english: Or rather, what are you doing here while everyone else is doing your job?

112.japanese: 電話切ったり パソコンやったり 電話切ったり
112.english: Hanging up on people and being on the computer. Hanging up on people...

113.speaker: HANDA
113.japanese: 全然 仕事してないじゃない

116.speaker: HANDA
116.japanese: 飼育係が自分で食べちゃダメでしょ
116.english: A zookeeper shouldn't eatthe animals' food.

117.speaker: PANDA
117.japanese: 僕 思うんだけどね やっぱり動物に動物の世話は
117.english: I've been thinking... I don't think it's possible for an animal

118.japanese: ムリだと思うんだよね
118.english: to take care of other animals. You can't keep complaining like that. There's nowhere else you can be reassigned to.

119.speaker: PANDA
119.japanese: え～っ じゃあ もうあとは 園長やるしかないかな
119.english: What? Then I guess I'll just have to be the zoo director. Zoo director?

120.speaker: KIRINO
120.japanese: 先輩… それだけは 絶対に阻止しましょうね
120.english: Let's do whatever we can to stop that from happening.

121.speaker: PANDA
121.japanese: 常勤パンダさんは しっかり やってるかな？
121.english: I wonder if Mr. Full-time Panda is doing his job.

122.speaker: LLAMA
122.japanese: あっ パンダくんじゃないですか

123.speaker: PANDA
123.japanese: ラマさん 何やってるの？
123.english: What are you doing, Mr. Llama?

124.speaker: LLAMA
124.japanese: 配置換えを希望したんですよ
124.english: I asked to be reassigned. So the Zoo Director reassigned Mr. Llama to the Panda Corner?

126.speaker: FT PANDA
126.japanese: 今から団体さん来るから サービス よろしくね
126.english: We're about to get a group of people, so don't forget about the service.

127.speaker: LLAMA
127.japanese: はい わかりました

131.speaker: KIRINO
131.japanese: ラマさん 大人気ですね 先輩
131.english: Mr. Llama is doing rather well, isn't he?

133.speaker: FT PANDA
133.japanese: サービス サービス サービス サービス
133.english: Service, service. Service, service. {\a6}Service, service. Wow, you're doing great.

134.speaker: LLAMA
134.japanese: パンダ 向いてるんじゃない？

135.speaker: FT PANDA
135.japanese: パンダ 向いてるんじゃない？
135.english: I think you're a great panda.

136.speaker: LLAMA
136.japanese: ラマやってるより 輝いてるよ

137.speaker: FT PANDA
137.japanese: ラマやってるより 輝いてるよ
137.english: You shine so much brighter than you do as a llama.

139.speaker: LLAMA
139.japanese: サービス サービス！ サービス サービス！
139.english: Service, service! Service, service! Service, service!

140.speaker: FT PANDA
140.japanese: いいねぇ キミ ホント 向いてるよ
140.english: You're doing great. Service, service! You were truly meant for this. Service, service!

141.speaker: KIRINO
141.japanese: 非常勤パンダ パンダコーナーに配属を命ず
141.english: "Part-time Panda is hereby reassigned to the Panda Corner."

142.speaker: KIRINO
142.japanese: パンダくん 元に 戻してもらったみたいですね
142.english: Looks like Panda had himself put back where he started.

143.speaker: PANDA
143.japanese: やっぱり 僕は パンダが いちばん向いてるね
143.english: Looks like being a panda is meant for me.

144.speaker: HANDA
144.japanese: ラマさん これ 今日のお昼ご飯ね
144.english: Hey, Mr. Llama. Here's your lunch for the day.

145.speaker: LLAMA
145.japanese: ありがとうございます

146.speaker: HANDA
146.japanese: 掃除は 午後にやるから
146.english: I'll be cleaning in the afternoon.

149.speaker: LLAMA
149.japanese: また配置換えの辞令 出ないですかね
149.english: I wonder if I'll get another reassignment.

151.speaker: MEIMEI
151.japanese: ねぇねぇ お兄ちゃん

153.speaker: MEIMEI
153.japanese: 私 昨日 お兄ちゃんが バイトしてる動物園へ遊びにいったのね
153.english: I went to the zoo that you work at yesterday.

155.speaker: MEIMEI
155.japanese: すごい かっこいい人 見つけちゃったの！
155.english: I saw this really good-looking guy!

156.speaker: PANDA
156.english: What? Does he work at the zoo?

157.speaker: MEIMEI
157.japanese: お兄ちゃん 知らない？
157.english: Do you know him? I can't recall any good-looking guys.

158.speaker: MEIMEI
158.japanese: パンダコーナーの近くで見たの
158.english: I saw him near the Panda Corner.

160.speaker: PANDA
160.japanese: あの人は まあまあ かっこいいよね

161.speaker: MEIMEI
161.english: So his name is Mr. Kirino?

163.speaker: MEIMEI
163.japanese: あら 違うわ もっと かっこよかったもん
163.english: What? No. He's way better looking than that. Huh?

165.speaker: PANDA
165.japanese: もしかして リンリン？
165.english: Don't tell me it's Rin Rin.

166.speaker: PANDA
166.japanese: アイツは ダメ ダメ ロクなヤツじゃないよ
166.english: Don't go near that guy. He's a total loser.

167.speaker: MEIMEI
167.japanese: リンリンなら知ってるもん 花屋の人でしょ？
167.english: I know who Rin Rin is. He's the florist, right?

170.speaker: PANDA
170.japanese: もう わかんないよ

171.speaker: MEIMEI
171.japanese: 私に優しく声をかけてくれて 竹をくれたのよ
171.english: He spoke nicely to me and gave me some bamboo.

172.speaker: MEIMEI
172.japanese: もう ドキドキしちゃって…
172.english: My heart was beating so fast!

175.speaker: MEIMEI
175.english: Yeah! That's totally him! He's so hot! My prince!

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: お… 王子？ 半田さんが？

177.speaker: MEIMEI
177.japanese: 半田さんっていうの？ ステキ…
177.english: His name is Mr. Handa? How wonderful.

178.speaker: PANDA
178.japanese: 半田さんに伝えておこうか？
178.english: Do you want me to tell Mr. Handa

179.speaker: PANDA
179.japanese: 妹が 王子って呼んでましたって
179.english: that my little sister is calling him her prince?

180.speaker: MEIMEI
180.japanese: えぇ 別に彼女になりたいとか思ってるわけじゃないの
180.english: What? Well, it's not like I want to be his girlfriend or anything. I just want to keep him in my heart.

181.speaker: MEIMEI
181.japanese: それだけで胸がいっぱいなの
181.english: Even that's enough to choke me up.

183.speaker: MEIMEI
183.japanese: こんなに かっこいいんだもん

185.speaker: PANDA
185.japanese: それ 半田さんの話だよね？
185.english: We're talking about Mr. Handa, right?

187.speaker: MEIMEI
187.japanese: かっこよくて すごくモテる王子様が他に どこにいるのよ！
187.english: Who else would be the extremely popular, good-looking prince? So, what kind of person is Prince Han?

190.speaker: MEIMEI
190.japanese: 聞きたいことメモして渡すから 聞いてきてよ お兄ちゃん
190.english: I'll write down what I want to ask, so you can go ask for me, Big Brother.

192.speaker: PANDA
192.japanese: 半田さん 半田さん！

197.speaker: PANDA
197.japanese: まず好きな食べ物だけど…

199.speaker: PANDA
199.japanese: 玉子焼きのはじっこだって
199.english: The very end of an omelette.

200.speaker: MEIMEI
200.japanese: グルメね！ 半様ステキ！
200.english: My, he's so refined! Prince Han is so amazing!

202.speaker: PANDA
202.japanese: えっと 趣味ってほどでもないけど ツルツルした小石集めが好きって
202.english: Let's see... He said it wasn't really a hobby, but he likes collecting smooth rocks.

206.speaker: PANDA
206.japanese: お休みの日の過ごし方は

207.speaker: PANDA
207.japanese: 洗濯したり 掃除したり…

208.speaker: PANDA
208.japanese: たまったスーパーの袋をきちんと三角に折ったりだって
208.english: and he folds used shopping bags into neat, little triangles.

211.speaker: MEIMEI
211.japanese: 知れば知るほど半様って最高ね！
211.english: The more I find out about him, the more wonderful Prince Han is! Mei Mei, eat some bamboo grass and calm down.

212.speaker: MEIMEI
212.japanese: お兄ちゃん わかってないわね
212.english: You just don't get it at all, Big Brother.

213.speaker: MEIMEI
213.japanese: あっ！ 半様の写真 撮ってきてない？
213.english: Oh! Did you take a picture of Prince Han? What? No, I didn't. Why not?!

214.speaker: PANDA
214.japanese: 半田さんの写真に興味ないもん
214.english: I have no interest in having pictures of Mr. Handa. Go take some. Go take tons of pictures of Prince Han being cool! Mr. Handa, Mr. Handa.

216.speaker: MEIMEI
216.japanese: キャー かっこいい！

218.speaker: PANDA
218.japanese: どう半田さんを見たら そう思えるの？
218.english: What about him makes you think that? His round face...

219.speaker: MEIMEI
219.japanese: モチッと小太りな体型とか

220.speaker: MEIMEI
220.english: Not to mention his legs are short.

222.speaker: MEIMEI
222.japanese: 最高じゃない パンダみたいで！
222.english: He's so great! He's just like a panda!

224.speaker: PANDA
224.japanese: うちの妹が 半様ってパンダみたいだって
224.english: My little sister says that Prince Han looks just like a panda. What? Who's Prince Han?

226.speaker: PANDA
226.japanese: すごく かっこいいんだって
226.english: She says he's really good-looking. Wow, Mr. Handa is quite popular.

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.japanese: なんか全然 半田さんに脈ないね
227.english: Mr. Handa is beyond hope. But my little sister keeps calling him Prince Han.

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.japanese: 妹さんと 半田さんの２人が結婚したら
228.english: If your little sister and Mr. Handa were to marry,

229.speaker: POLAR BEAR
229.japanese: パンダくん 半田さんのお兄さんだね
229.english: you'd be Mr. Handa's older brother, Panda. I'd be Mr. Handa's older brother?

230.speaker: HANDA
230.japanese: お兄さん 朝食の竹です
230.english: Here's your breakfast bamboo, Big Brother.

231.speaker: HANDA
231.japanese: お兄さん 昼食の竹です
231.english: Big Brother, here is your lunch bamboo.

232.speaker: HANDA
232.japanese: お兄さん 食後の竹です
232.english: Here's your after-meal bamboo, Big Brother.

233.speaker: HANDA
233.japanese: お兄さん 真夜中の竹です
233.english: Here's your midnight snack bamboo, Big Brother.

234.speaker: PANDA
234.japanese: お腹いっぱいになっちゃうなぁ

236.speaker: PANDA
236.japanese: 半田さん うちのお母さんと うまくやっていけるかな？
236.english: I wonder if Mr. Handa would get along with my mom.

237.speaker: HANDA
237.japanese: お母さん どうも 半田です

238.speaker: HANDA
238.english: Seconds on bamboo, please! Don't suck me up!

239.speaker: PANDA
239.japanese: 婿と姑の関係は 難しいっていうしね
239.english: They say that the groom's relationship with his mother-in-law can be difficult.

240.speaker: PANDA
240.english: Oh, it's Mr. Handa. Maybe this place would be good?

241.speaker: HANDA
241.japanese: 僕も ここがいいと思うよ
241.english: I think that one is good, too.

242.speaker: LADY
242.japanese: 新婚さんには お似合いの物件だと思いますよ
242.english: It's a perfect place for newlyweds.

243.speaker: HANDA
243.japanese: えっ！？ や… やだ！ 新婚さんだなんて
243.english: What?! Oh, did you hear that? She said "newlyweds."

244.speaker: PANDA
244.japanese: 半田さん… アナグマさんと結婚するの？
244.english: Mr. Handa is getting married to Ms. Badger?

247.speaker: PANDA
247.japanese: メイメイには言えないよ…

248.speaker: MEIMEI
248.japanese: ねぇ ねぇ お兄ちゃん！

249.speaker: MEIMEI
249.japanese: 今日も半様かっこよかった？
249.english: Was Prince Han amazing today, too? What?

250.speaker: PANDA
250.japanese: さ… さぁ？ どうかな…

251.speaker: MEIMEI
251.japanese: え～っ！ すごく楽しみにしてるのに
251.english: What? But I was looking forward to hearing all about it.

252.speaker: MEIMEI
252.english: See? My Prince Han diary. I write in it every day.

256.japanese: 乙女のプライバシーなんだから
256.english: You'll be invading a lady's privacy.

258.speaker: MEIMEI
258.japanese: 私 こっそり動物園に行こうかな
258.english: Maybe I'll secretly go to the zoo. What?

259.speaker: MEIMEI
259.japanese: それでね 陰からこっそり見守るの
259.english: And I'll secretly watch over him from the shadows.

262.speaker: PANDA
262.english: No. You'll see a side of Mr. Handa he doesn't want you to see.

263.speaker: MEIMEI
263.japanese: 見られたくないところ？
263.english: A side he doesn't want me to see? Anyway, you shouldn't go.

265.speaker: PANDA
265.japanese: やっぱり メイメイには言えないよ
265.english: There's no way I can tell Mei Mei.

267.speaker: KOALA
267.japanese: おめでとうございます

269.speaker: LLAMA
269.english: You two look great together. Huh?

270.speaker: OTTER
270.japanese: 職場結婚するんでしょ？ アナグマさんと
270.english: You're getting married to Ms. Badger, right?

275.speaker: HANDA
275.japanese: 僕が アナグマさんと結婚するだなんて…
275.english: telling everyone that Ms. Badger and I are getting married! About that... You should at least let me know before you do it.

276.speaker: PANDA
276.english: It's rather shocking when it's so sudden.

277.speaker: HANDA
277.japanese: だから なんで そういう話になってるの！？
277.english: I want to know what made you think that!

278.speaker: FT PANDA
278.japanese: この前 アナグマさんと 新居探しをしてたらしいじゃない
278.english: I heard you and Ms. Badger were looking for a new home together.

279.speaker: HANDA
279.japanese: あれは アナグマさんが 新しく 部屋探すから
279.english: Ms. Badger was looking for a new place to stay,

280.speaker: HANDA
280.japanese: 保証人になってただけです！
280.english: so I was there to be her co-signer!

284.speaker: HANDA
284.japanese: どうも こんばんは
284.english: Hi, good evening. My name is Handa.

285.speaker: HANDA
285.japanese: パンダくん ぐっすり寝ちゃって 起きなくて
285.english: Panda fell asleep and wouldn't wake up. There we go.

286.speaker: HANDA
286.japanese: じゃあ 僕はこれで
286.english: Well, I'll be going now. Oh! Um...

288.speaker: MEIMEI
288.japanese: よ… よかったら お茶でも…

289.speaker: HANDA
289.japanese: ありがとうございます
289.english: Thank you for the offer. But the light bulb in my bathroom burned out, so I have to pick up a new one.

290.speaker: HANDA
290.japanese: 近所のスーパー ９時までなんで
290.english: The store by my house closes at 9 PM.

292.speaker: MEIMEI
292.japanese: 半様って  よく気がつくうえに しっかり者なんだ！
292.english: Prince Han is so observant on top of being so responsible!

293.speaker: MEIMEI
293.japanese: お兄ちゃんは 切れた電球を買って帰るなんて
293.english: Big Brother would never think of buying light bulbs to replace a light. Huh? I'm home?

294.speaker: MEIMEI
294.japanese: お兄ちゃん 聞いた！？

296.speaker: MEIMEI
296.japanese: 半様 スーパー ９時までだって！
296.english: Prince Han said the store closes at 9 PM! He's so amazing!

298.speaker: MEIMEI
298.english: Prince Han said he had to get to the store by 9 PM.

299.speaker: PANDA
299.japanese: それは 書かなくていいんじゃないかな？
299.english: I don't think you need to write that.

300.speaker: POLAR BEAR
300.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん
300.english: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin. What is it, Polar Bear, all of a sudden?

301.speaker: POLAR BEAR
301.japanese: たまにはやってみたくて
301.english: I wanted to try that once.

302.speaker: POLAR BEAR
302.japanese: はい どうぞ 初めて

303.speaker: PANDA
303.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

306.speaker: POLAR BEAR
306.japanese: ごめん ごめん たまにはやってみたくて
306.english: Sorry, sorry. I wanted to try that once.

308.speaker: PANDA
308.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

311.speaker: PENGUIN
311.japanese: 来週にしろくまカフェは再来週お送りします

312.speaker: POLAR BEAR
312.japanese: 来週にしろくまカフェは再来週お送りします
312.english: Next week's Polar Bear's Café will air the following week.

313.speaker: PENGUIN
313.english: It's going to air next week!
